result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tevin T. McComis appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Brian Andrew Herro in court for Tevin T. McComis. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Bail motion heard. Arguments. Court makes findings and amends bail.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tevin T. McComis appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Tevin T. McComis as a friend of the court. Defendant will retain private counsel. Counsel waives reading. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $7500 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests $1000 cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
